item.presentation:
A ball is shot out of a spring loaded gun at an angle as shown.  “Initial” is before the trigger is pulled.  “Final” is when the ball is at maximum height. 

As  we have already discussed, the energy bar chart depends on our choice of system.  Here are two options:

Suppose two students are trying to write down correct conservation of energy equations for this situation.  Student A chooses the system of ball, spring, Earth and writes the equation:

$$U_{si} = U_{gf} + K_f$$

Student B chooses the system of ball, spring (Earth not in system) and writes the equation:

$$U_{si} = K_f$$

 Are these both correct conservation of energy equations for this situation?

item.label: answer
item.presentation: r>>>>>Yes, both are correct. |No, both are incorrect because neither includes an initial gravitational potential energy. |A is correct. B is incorrect because the system is not closed so \( E_i \neq E_f \). |B is correct. A is incorrect because the system is not closed so \( E_i \neq E_f \).
